intro: Submatucana currundayensis, commonly known as the Currundayensis plant, is a species native to the Andean region of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
